Everyone should share the goal of wanting transparent secure and auditable elections. One way to do that is to be honest about vulnerabilities and constantly work to mitigate them while taking seriously allegations of fraud.   This letter strikes the right balance IMO. https://t.co/VS5XakMwXN

Reflecting on all this country has accomplished and the ideals we stand for I am eternally grateful for the gift that is America. No matter what anyone says ours is the greatest nation ever conceived and I am darn proud of us.  #HappyFourthOfJuly 🇺🇸🇺🇸🇺🇸

Another solid month of job gains. As I’ve said before we aren’t out of the woods yet. But this is progress worth getting excited about.  U.S. economy gains 4.8 million jobs unemployment rate falls to 11.1 percent https://t.co/ExUJad6eI3 via @nbcnews

Great to see our Governor put forth these guidelines to bring our children back to school safely. I know there are parents who are still concerned. I’m one of them. But the truth is the evidence is mounting that this is the right thing to do and I’m thankful for this leadership. https://t.co/K3Nk1r7a32

As I’ve said before I believe the starting point with schools needs to be “We are going back in the fall.” Need to do it safely make adjustments where necessary etc.   Happy to see the American Academy of Pediatrics looking at the science to date and taking this stand. 👏👏 https://t.co/wJJdXpeFmM

@DAvelikesCAke The qualified immunity piece. QA needs major reforms but abolishing it altogether is a bridge too far for me. I also just generally think our bill would be more effective though there is sincere disagreement on that.

As we’ve seen a sizable uptick in new cases we need to double down on our own personal commitments to get past this virus. Lord knows I don’t like the masks myself but the truth is they are the easiest thing we can do when we’re out in public to reduce spread. #StaySafeOhio https://t.co/HMKb6t7FMn
Good and accurate thread. https://t.co/nq5JnwzIJQ

@LtningSams It was about injustice for about 10 days. Then it got overrun by the anarchists and marxists. Now it’s just about mindless destruction. It’s sad because there is universal agreement we need to address long-standing injustice but the message gets lost when this nonsense persists.

This is a good start. We should never be in the business of funding or supporting Chinese companies that have clear and direct ties to the Chinese military. Happy to see this move.  Pentagon Names 20 Chinese Firms It Says Are Military-Controlled https://t.co/FF96b1Zn3m

Our healthcare system is built more with payers and providers in the drivers seat which results in excessive costs and mismatched incentives.   A patient-centered system will give individuals choice access and flexibility to protect their families.  A lot to like in this piece https://t.co/jpYmOvHV4I

Good to see some progress but still a very long way to go to getting our people back to work and our economy back on sound footing.  Ohio unemployment claims down nearly 300000 from April peak https://t.co/N7PcDta2Ie

A critical part of bringing down the cost of healthcare involves price transparency on the services we receive. Today’s ruling is an important step in the right direction for patients and their families.  Hospitals Sued to Keep Prices Secret. They Lost. https://t.co/Bt1NSJJBEG

Thank you Governor.   I will forever support the right for people to peacefully protest. The majority have done that and nothing is more American.  We can never tolerate vandalism looting or violence of any kind. We cannot throw out the legal system no matter what the cause. https://t.co/hiZK3jywkr

It’s good the market has rebounded but we can’t ignore the fact that unemployment is still over 10%. We need to get our people back to work as quickly and safely as possible.  More Stocks Are Driving Market Rally Decreasing Reliance on Big Tech - WSJ https://t.co/oQ50ZGypxo

@J2inCLE Thank you. To you and your dad as well!
Happy Father’s Day to all the dads out there!

Today we celebrate #Juneteenth   On this day in 1865 Union Gen. Gordon Granger proclaimed the freedom for all remaining slaves. Months would pass until the 13th Amendment was officially ratified but today marked the beginning of the end of the most shameful part of our history.

This video brings a smile to my face because it’s a reminder of what fun we all have together.  But it’s also clear these shutdowns need to end. We destroyed the economy and stopped living life. If dancing in the streets is ok so is everything else.   https://t.co/OlgIpeBAjr

@GCTigerTracker Most Improved Player award goes to Chuck. I was certain he was going to end up in the drink on 18.

Well that was fun. Not the best golf I’ve ever seen but a heckuva fundraiser actual live sports and it was nice to see my old QB and @TigerWoods come away with a close win.   You’re next @NBA @MLB @NHL @MLS @NCAA and of course @NFL

One of our top priorities must be to make sure that schools can open and stay open in the fall. We have more than 3 months. Changes can be made but full online learning is not fair to kids or parents.  Ohio Gov. DeWine Weighs How to Reopen Schools https://t.co/VazvWgepLG
Reading a book on potty training for my son and the line “When going through hell ... for God’s sake keep going” came up. 😂  This ought to be fun.

Errors like this damage the public trust and lead to disregard for guidance and the baseless conspiracy theories that fill the void when credibility falls. https://t.co/5IuZjiPyNc

In a country of 23 million people Taiwan has 7 deaths from coronavirus. If there is anyone we should be learning from it’s them.   Their exclusion from the World Health Assembly is unconscionable and another example of CCP control over the ⁦@WHO⁩.   https://t.co/IRF3ido7p6
@brianhartline Can’t believe I made the wall! I’ll take it.

As the father of two young kids one thing Elizabeth and I talk a lot about is screen time and social media use for our kids. @JonHaidt is doing the best of anyone at conducting and consolidating the research on these topics.  Here’s a great summary from him. https://t.co/HOSjAPwHZq
@AlexNFlorida @CDCgov Every second of it. Can’t imagine a more accurate portrayal of Jordan and the 90s Bulls. They really nailed it.

I wrote an oped to this effect a few weeks back. With well over 1 million cases and 80k deaths @CDCgov should constantly be publishing robust guidance and critical info. It’s one of the simplest ways to improve outcomes and lower the public anxiety.  https://t.co/fY3bvijhqP https://t.co/2EN3OgtnCS

This hasn’t always been the case. The Europeans have been playing footsie with the CCP for decades just as we had previously done. This pandemic should serve as the final straw by which a unified voice emerges that demands significant CCP reform. This can never happen again.

There are many things we can do on our own - i.e. move critical supply chains home. But to fully reform the system it’s going to take our allies committing to uphold our shared values. Freedom and openness must lead the world not CCP totalitarianism.  https://t.co/xiC2h3WQjW
Agree 100%. If you trade on our stock exchanges you need to adhere to our same audit standards. https://t.co/iZU4yfRz0O
@CoalBanger Couldn’t agree more. I don’t know how anyone can stand here on May 13th and say that an entire fall semester that doesn’t start for 3 months needs to be cancelled.

Every role I ever saw Jerry Stiller in he made me laugh. I’ll be celebrating Festivus in his honor this year. Covid-related Airing of Grievances shaping up to be a lengthy one this 2020. https://t.co/aejlgDz6tJ
Happy Mother’s Day to all the superhero moms out there and a special wish to the two wonderful ladies in my life - Mom and Elizabeth. Every year I love you more and more.

The key to more widespread safe re-openings is the deployment of widespread rapid results tests that give answers in minutes not days.   We can get there but we need the tech to catch up https://t.co/jjOzybXstR

Without going point by point I believe it is one of the worst attempts at data analysis that I have seen during this crisis.  Having said that @YouTube also shouldn’t be censoring it. These doctors have just as much right to be wrong as anyone else.

I don’t normally comment on these sorts of things but here goes:  1. I think we should start to re-open the economy in a thoughtful way.   2. We should use sound data science to guide us.  3. This viral video was wildly off the mark with their analysis.  cc:@TuckerCarlson https://t.co/ToSuTkSso2
@LtningSams Now this is funny. I’m thankful to know that even the nudist camp is practicing effective social distancing. 😂
